moves.3... e6 4. Nf3 d5: Now, the game shares some similarities with the French defense.
moves.5. Bb5 Bd6: In the French, it is more common to develop the bishop to e7 and the king knight to f6.  If white plays, e5 at some point, the knight is rerouted to d7.
moves.6. d3: 6. exd5 was probably better.  6. e5 Bc7 7. d4 was also possible.
moves.6... Nge7 7. O-O O-O 8. e5 Bc7 9. d4: Turning the game into an advanced French where d3-d4 was a wasted tempo.
moves.9... c4: Black should've either maintained the tension in the center, or captured on d4..
moves.10. Bxc6: The bishop has no future, so white gets what he can for it.
moves.10... bxc6: or 10. ...Nxc6 intending to advance the b-pawn.  That's what I would've done.
moves.11. g4: When you have a spatial advantage, you must attack.
moves.11... Ng6 12. Qe1: A typical queen manuver to sore up e5 and enable the transfer of the queen to the kingside via the e1-h4 diagonal.
moves.12... Qe7 13. Ne2: freeing the c-pawn to aid in the defense of the d4 pawn, and preparing to shift the knight to the kingside.
moves.13... c5: Black must try to break up white's center.
moves.14... cxd4 15. cxd4: 15. Nexd4 was much better.  I don't know what I was thinking when I played 15. cxd4.  Temporary insanity!  At least, I hope its temporary!
moves.15... f6: The only chance to challenge White's center.
moves.16. Qg3 Ba6 17. Nc3: If I had maintained the pawn on c3, black would've been stifled.
moves.19. h4 Bd8 20. g5 h5: Keeping the kingside closed.  A good move.
A whopper of a mistake.  29. Ng2 was indicated.
moves.29... Qf5: Now, Black has a big edge.
moves.30. Ne1 Qb1 31. Bd2 Qxa2 32. Nf3 Qb1+ 33: The passed a-pawn can be stopped, but it will divert white's forces to the queenside.
moves.34. Qg1 Qb2 35. Qc1 Qa2 36. Kg3 a4 37. N: While white wastes time on the queenside, black redeploys his pieces on the kingside.
moves.38... Kh7 39. Na1 Qb5 40. Nc2 Ne7 41. Nb: Now the bishop has been activated.  When pawns are locked in a chain as they are in this game, you want your bishop in front of the chain.
Black did not need to sacrifice the knight.  45. ...Ne3 was more than sufficient.
moves.50. Qa1 Qg2: There is no way to protect h3.
moves.51... Bf5 52. g6+ Kxg6: A nice mating net finishes white off. 0-1.
